headline: Wall Street Pulls Back on the Weight-Loss Drug Hype
summary: Through all the market madness of the past two years, there has been one truth universally acknowledged by the analysts who track healthcare stocks on Wall Street: that the market for the new, effective obesity drugs will be even bigger than anyone expects.  Shares of  Eli Lilly  have trailed the market, and Novo’s American depositary receipt is down roughly half over the past year, but analysts kept raising their estimates for sales of both company’s top weight-loss drugs.  Why were the stocks underperforming if the growth outlook kept getting better?

raw.headline: Wall Street Pulls Back on the Weight-Loss Drug Hype
